page.title: 07Farming in Chalton
page.content: Most of the land in Chalton has been taken over by fairly large scale farms.{The major farming concern is {run from Manor Farm by the Budden {family who control an area of over {2000}acres. About one half of this is used for wheat production the remainder being split into growing beans, barley, peas and rape. Some livestock are kept the beef herd varying between 60 and 120 head. Over the past few years there has been a gradual increase in the amount of rape grown. The whole farm only employs six full time men, casual labour being hired on a limited basis when needed. A fairly high degree of mechanisation is used including four combine harvesters, two of which can tilt for use on hill slopes,thus increasing usable land area.
